content:
WorkflowCompiler Class

Definition

Represents the compiler for workflows that are developed using C# or Visual Basic code and/or XAML markup. This class cannot be inherited.

In this Article

[System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated.  Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")]
public sealed class WorkflowCompiler
Inheritance
Object
WorkflowCompiler
Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)
ToString()

Examples

The following code example demonstrates how to create a new instance of the WorkflowCompiler class and run the [Compile(WorkflowCompilerParameters,â€‚String<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.WorkflowCompiler.Compile%2A> method. The code also creates a new instance of the WorkflowCompilerParameters class and sets some of its values. This code assumes that results is of type WorkflowCompilerResults. This code example is part of the Outlook Workflow Wizard SDK sample from the WizardForm.cs file. For more information, see Outlook Workflow Wizard. 

// Compile the workflow
String[] assemblyNames = { "ReadEmailActivity.dll" };
WorkflowCompiler compiler = new WorkflowCompiler();
WorkflowCompilerParameters parameters = new WorkflowCompilerParameters(assemblyNames);
parameters.LibraryPaths.Add(Path.GetDirectoryName(typeof(BaseMailbox).Assembly.Location));
parameters.OutputAssembly = "CustomOutlookWorkflow" + Guid.NewGuid().ToString() + ".dll";
results = compiler.Compile(parameters, this.xamlFile);

' Compile the workflow
Dim assemblyNames() As String = {"ReadEmailActivity.dll"}

Dim compiler As WorkflowCompiler = New WorkflowCompiler()
Dim parameters As WorkflowCompilerParameters = New WorkflowCompilerParameters(assemblyNames)
parameters.LibraryPaths.Add(Path.GetDirectoryName(GetType(BaseMailbox).Assembly.Location))
parameters.OutputAssembly = "CustomOutlookWorkflow" + Guid.NewGuid().ToString() + ".dll"
results = compiler.Compile(parameters, Me.xamlFile)

Remarks

Note

This material discusses types and namespaces that are obsolete. For more information, see Deprecated Types in Windows Workflow Foundation 4.5.

Constructors

WorkflowCompiler()

Initializes a new instance of the WorkflowCompiler class.

public WorkflowCompiler ();
Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute

Methods

Compile(WorkflowCompilerParameters, String[])

Compiles a list of workflows contained in the files that are passed as parameters based on the WorkflowCompilerParameters.

public System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.WorkflowCompilerResults Compile (System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.WorkflowCompilerParameters parameters, string[] files);
Parameters
parameters
WorkflowCompilerParameters

The WorkflowCompilerParameters.

files
String[]

A string array that contains the paths to the files to compile. These files can be either code files (such as .vb or .cs) or workflow markup files. Workflow markup files must have an .xoml extension to be recognized by the compiler.

Returns
WorkflowCompilerResults

The WorkflowCompilerResults representing the results of the operation.

Attributes
ObsoleteAttribute
Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

files is a null reference (Visual Basic Nothing).
